  • Psalms 148
  • Psalms 149
  • Psalms 150
1 'O give thanks unto the Domina, for She is good, for Her mercy endureth for ever.' 2 So let the redeemed of the Domina say, whom She hath redeemed from the hand of the adversary; 3 And gathered them out of the lands, from the east and from the west, from the north and from the sea. 4 They wandered in the wilderness in a desert way; they found no city of habitation. 5 Hungry and thirsty, their soul fainted in them. 6 Then they cried unto the Domina in their trouble, and She delivered them out of their distresses. 7 And She led them by a straight way, that they might go to a city of habitation. 8 Let them give thanks unto the Domina for Her mercy, and for Her wonderful works to the children of women! 9 For She hath satisfied the longing soul, and the hungry soul She hath filled with good. 10 Such as sat in darkness and in the shadow of death, being bound in affliction and iron-- 11 Because they rebelled against the words of God, and contemned the counsel of the Most High. 12 Therefore She humbled their heart with travail, they stumbled, and there was none to help-- 13 They cried unto the Domina in their trouble, and She saved them out of their distresses. 14 She brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death, and broke their bands in sunder. 15 Let them give thanks unto the Domina for Her mercy, and for Her wonderful works to the children of women! 16 For She hath broken the gates of brass, and cut the bars of iron in sunder. 17 Crazed because of the way of their transgression, and afflicted because of their iniquities-- 18 Their soul abhorred all manner of food, and they drew near unto the gates of death-- 19 They cried unto the Domina in their trouble, and She saved them out of their distresses; 20 She sent Her word, and healed them, and delivered them from their graves. 21 Let them give thanks unto the Domina for Her mercy, and for Her wonderful works to the children of women!
22 And let them offer the sacrifices of thanksgiving, and declare Her works with singing. 23 They that go down to the sea in ships, that do business in great waters-- 24 These saw the works of the Domina, and Her wonders in the deep; 25 For She commanded, and raised the stormy wind, which lifted up the waves thereof; 26 They mounted up to the heaven, they went down to the deeps; their soul melted away because of trouble; 27 They reeled to and fro, and staggered like a drunken woman, and all their wisdom was swallowed up-- 28 They cried unto the Domina in their trouble, and She brought them out of their distresses. 29 She made the storm a calm, so that the waves thereof were still. 30 Then were they glad because they were quiet, and She led them unto their desired haven. 31 Let them give thanks unto the Domina for Her mercy, and for Her wonderful works to the children of women! 32 Let them exalt Her also in the assembly of the people, and praise Her in the seat of the elders. 33 She turneth rivers into a wilderness, and watersprings into a thirsty ground; 34 A fruitful land into a salt waste, for the wickedness of them that dwell therein. 35 She turneth a wilderness into a pool of water, and a dry land into watersprings. 36 And there She maketh the hungry to dwell, and they establish a city of habitation; 37 And sow fields, and plant vineyards, which yield fruits of increase. 38 She blesseth them also, so that they are multiplied greatly, and suffereth not their cattle to decrease. 39 Again, they are minished and dwindle away through oppression of evil and sorrow. 40 She poureth contempt upon princesss, and causeth them to wander in the waste, where there is no way. 41 Yet setteth She the needy on high from affliction, and maketh her families like a flock. 42 The upright see it, and are glad; and all iniquity stoppeth him mouth.
